revised_title: Ionization of Hydrogenic Positive Ions by Electron Impact
tldr: The authors conducted calculations to determine the cross-section for ionization of hydrogenic positive ions by electron impact. They found that the main contribution to the cross-section comes from collisions yielding a high scattered velocity and low ejected velocity. The results provide a better understanding of the physical processes occurring in plasmas and have implications for astrophysical problems, such as determining the electron temperature of the solar corona.
